result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Donald III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge WAIVED.

No violent contact with victim Yolanda D.
Domestic Violence Counseling to be determined by Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Case called regarding a letter filed by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant Robert Donald in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises the defendant was ordered to submit to a DNA sample, surcharge was waived, not the sample.  Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample on or before 10/27/2016.
Hearing on October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Received September 27, 2016, dated September 26, 2016 from DOC regarding DNA, with letter from Robert Donald

Defendant Robert Donald in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim makes statements.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:
Withheld Sentence of: (Credit - 2 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year
Probation may be terminated after 6 months if deemed by agent. 
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with victim Yolanda D.
Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
COSTS:  $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 WAIVED
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert Donald in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in. Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
